name: Identify Five Red Flags in the Text
description: Read the story and identify five red flags that indicate a lack of empathy.
detailed_activity: Step 1: Read the short story provided by the teacher.
Step 2: Highlight or note down any actions or behaviors that seem unfair or unkind.
Step 3: Discuss in pairs why these actions could be red flags for empathy.
Step 4: Share your five red flags with the class.
Step 5: Reflect on what could have been done differently to show empathy.

name: Emotion Charades
description: Students act out emotions while others guess, helping them understand emotional expressions.
detailed_activity: Step 1: Write different emotions (happy, sad, angry, nervous, excited) on small cards.
Step 2: One student picks a card and acts out the emotion without speaking.
Step 3: Other students try to guess the emotion being acted out.
Step 4: Discuss how that emotion looks and feels in real life.
Step 5: Reflect on how we can respond when someone else feels that way.

name: My Inner Weather Report
description: Students describe how they are feeling today using weather metaphors.
detailed_activity: Step 1: Ask students, 'What is your inner weather today?'
Step 2: Encourage answers like 'sunny' (happy), 'cloudy' (confused), 'stormy' (angry), etc.
Step 3: Students can draw or write their 'weather report' in journals.
Step 4: Invite volunteers to share their weather and why they feel that way.
Step 5: Discuss how weather changes and so do our feelings.

name: Mirror Talk
description: Students practice affirmations in front of a mirror to boost self-awareness and confidence.
detailed_activity: Step 1: Provide each student with a mirror or allow them to use a reflective surface.
Step 2: Ask them to look into the mirror and say a positive statement about themselves (e.g., 'I am kind.').
Step 3: Provide a list of affirmations for those who need help getting started.
Step 4: Repeat this exercise daily or weekly to build confidence.
Step 5: Discuss how positive self-talk can help in tough situations.

name: Feelings Wheel
description: Students spin a wheel to explore and talk about different feelings and what causes them.
detailed_activity: Step 1: Create or display a wheel with various emotions on it.
Step 2: One student spins the wheel to land on an emotion.
Step 3: The student describes a time when they felt that emotion.
Step 4: Other students can ask supportive questions or share similar experiences.
Step 5: Reflect on how talking about emotions helps us understand ourselves better.
